com.xebialabs.overthere
Class OverthereConnection

java.lang.Object
  com.xebialabs.overthere.OverthereConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CifsConnection, LocalConnection
public abstract class OverthereConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

A connection on a host (local or remote) on which to manipulate files and execute commands. All methods in this interface may throw a RuntimeIOException if an error occurs. Checked IOExceptions are never thrown.

Method Detail

getHostOperatingSystem

public final OperatingSystemFamily getHostOperatingSystem()
Return the OS family of the host.

Returns:
the OS family

close

public final void close()
Closes the connection. Depending on the ConnectionOptions.TEMPORARY_DIRECTORY_DELETE_ON_DISCONNECT connection option, deletes all temporary files that have been created on the host.

Specified by:
close in interface java.io.Closeable

doClose

protected abstract void doClose()
To be overridden by a base class to implement connection specific disconnection logic.

getFile

public abstract OverthereFile getFile(java.lang.String hostPath)
Creates a reference to a file on the host.

Parameters:
hostPath - the path of the host
Returns:
a reference to the file

getFile

public abstract OverthereFile getFile(OverthereFile parent,
                                      java.lang.String child)
Creates a reference to a file in a directory on the host.

Parameters:
parent - the reference to the directory on the host
child - the name of the file in the directory
Returns:
a reference to the file in the directory

getTempFile

public final OverthereFile getTempFile(java.lang.String nameTemplate)
Creates a reference to a temporary file on the host. This file has a unique name and will be automatically removed when this connection is closed. N.B.: The file is not actually created until a put method is invoked.

Parameters:
nameTemplate - the template on which to base the name of the temporary file. May be null.
Returns:
a reference to the temporary file on the host

getTempFile

public final OverthereFile getTempFile(java.lang.String prefix,
                                       java.lang.String suffix)
                                throws RuntimeIOException
Creates a reference to a temporary file on the host. This file has a unique name and will be automatically removed when this connection is closed. N.B.: The file is not actually created until a put method is invoked.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix string to be used in generating the file's name; must be at least three characters long
suffix - the suffix string to be used in generating the file's name; may be null, in which case the suffix ".tmp" will be used
Returns:
a reference to the temporary file on the host
Throws:
RuntimeIOException

getFileForTempFile

protected abstract OverthereFile getFileForTempFile(OverthereFile parent,
                                                    java.lang.String name)
Invoked by getTempFile(String) and createConnectionTemporaryDirectory() to create an OverthereFile object for a file or directory in the system or connection temporary directory.

Parameters:
parent - parent of the file to create
name - name of the file to create.
Returns:
the created file object

getWorkingDirectory

public OverthereFile getWorkingDirectory()
Returns the working directory.

Returns:
the working directory, may be null.

setWorkingDirectory

public void setWorkingDirectory(OverthereFile workingDirectory)
Sets the working directory in which commands are executed. If set to null, the working directory that is used depends on the connection implementation.

Parameters:
workingDirectory - the working directory, may be null.

execute

public int execute(OverthereProcessOutputHandler handler,
                   CmdLine commandLine)
Executes a command with its arguments.

Parameters:
handler - the handler that will be invoked when the executed command generated output.
commandLine - the command line to execute.
Returns:
the exit value of the executed command. Usually 0 on successful execution.

startProcess

public OverthereProcess startProcess(CmdLine commandLine)
Starts a command with its argument and returns control to the caller.

Parameters:
commandLine - the command line to execute.
Returns:
an object representing the executing command or null if this is not supported by the host connection.

canStartProcess

public final boolean canStartProcess()
Checks whether a process can be started on this connection.

Returns:
true if a process can be started on this connection, false otherwise

toString

public abstract java.lang.String toString()
Subclasses MUST implement toString properly.
